meanings.definition: To make (an instrument) less in tune.
meanings.sent1: She was detuning her guitar to play a different song.
meanings.sent2: The musician accidentally detuned his violin while practicing.
meanings.sent3: The piano started detuning itself, creating a comical off-key melody.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled through the window, detuning the peaceful silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic carefully detuned the engine to adjust its performance.

meanings.definition: The act of making (an instrument) less in tune.
meanings.sent1: The detuning of the piano was intentional for the experimental music piece.
meanings.sent2: His ears could detect even the slightest detuning of the guitar strings.
meanings.sent3: The detuning of the orchestra's instruments caused a wave of laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The detuning of the radio signal made the music sound like a distant memory.
meanings.sent5: The gradual detuning of the violin added a haunting quality to the performance.
